SENT.plain: We report a case of spontaneous left pulmonary artery thrombosis in a 3-day-old male neonate
The presentation of heparin resistance and thrombosis raised the possibility of a type II heparin binding site antithrombin deficiency
A continuous infusion of antithrombin concentrate was used successfully, following failure of plasma, to correct the heparin resistance
Rapid genetic analysis allowed sequencing of the antithrombin gene within 5 working days
This showed the infant to be homozygous for the substitution of C to T at nucleotide 2759
This base change causes mutation of the native leucine at codon 99 to a phenylalanine
This antithrombin variant has been previously reported (antithrombin Budapest 3) and results in reduced binding of heparin to antithrombin
Such a molecular diagnostic approach is feasible and warranted in such cases of neonatal thrombosis because of the diagnostic difficulties encountered
